content.description: On the left wall in the lower corridor, this is the third bolted route encountered.  This climbs through a steep, pumpy water trough on mostly big jugs.  The natural line seems to climb slightly left of the bolts the whole way up.
content.protection: 4 bolts, fixed anchors with a one rope rappel

content.description: Turning Formosa is the first route in the second cluster of routes up the canyon.  It is fairly long with a tricky crux near the top.

A back bending start through a powerful bulge leads to a less than ideal rest; relax and clip the bolt. Suspicious holds and hidden jugs lead you up and slightly right to a great rest before the anchors. Shake out and fire the desperate finish!

If you climb left of the bolt line you'll put together enough to make this route .11b

If you get lured right of the bolt line and finish through the black streaked bulge, you've earned yourself a solid .12a
content.protection: Four or five draws to a shared anchor.
content.location:
Follow the trail from the road up through the corridor passing three routes on the hikers left.

Spoils of War

is the first route after the small gap and the first route after

Your Little Sister

. Directly right is the

Unnamed .11c

content.description: A really fun route up a vertical wall with a slightly overhanging crux. Veer left after the last bolt to get to the anchors. Nice sustained route.
content.location: Head up the corridor for a few minutes, until you find the clean bolted wall on the left. Rainmaker is the right most bolted line.

content.description: The first bolted route in Maple Canyon! Located on the left wall in the lower corridor, this is the second bolted route encountered.  This shares a common first bolt with Environmental Impact Statement (5.10b).  Juggy and steep climbing.
content.protection: 5 bolts, fixed anchors with a one rope rappel

content.description: This is the second route in the second cluster of routes in the Corridor.  Moving through the first 25 feet is the crux, though the route is fairly sustained.  Fun pitch.

A thin start on slightly less-than-vertical rock followed by pockets and jugs to overhanging terrain with a few thin crimps and slopey pockets. The overhang is followed by jugs and easier terrain to the anchors.
content.protection:
7 bolts to chains (shared with

Rainmaker

on the right).
content.location:
At the upper end of

Maple Corridor

this is the second route from the right side and is located across from a short, cloven rock formation.

content.description: This route is in the cluster of bolted routes a few hundred feet up the corridor.  As of when I climbed it, it was the 5th bolted route from the left in the upper section of Maple Corridor.  Mostly big holds (with a couple of surprising slopers!) climb through 4 bolts to a drop in open shut anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts, open shuts at the top

content.description: Really a fun route using a mixture of holds.
content.location:
Fifth route on the left as you walk up Maple Corridor, just to the right of

Spoils of War

.

content.description: Varied and enjoyable climbing to a huge rest then over the bulge. Well protected. Choose wisely whether you go right or left over the bulge. The guidebook rates this 11c.
content.location: To the right of Beer Quester. Look for the interesting line with an obvious roof to overcome.

content.description: Fun crux near the end of the route consisting of laybacks or a nice finger lock if one feels brave enough to attempt it. Bottom section is easy and route steepens as one climbs higher. Definately worth doing if your in the area.
content.protection: Quickdraws. Chain anchors at the top of the climb.
content.location: Shares the first bolt with Raindrops On Lichen but instead of going right for raindrops on lichen go left and enjoy EIS (5.10b)This is the first route on climbers left as one enters the maple corridor.

content.description: Climb this route straight vertical on balanced crimpers. The crux is at the top. The guidebook said 11a, it felt easier.
content.location: Third route from the left. Starts on a 3 finger pocket at head height. The area is great when its very hot.
